item.title: Tripcode Generator
item.dc:creator: @z z
item.description:
@z wrote:

function __tripCode($password){ $password = mb_convert_encoding($password,'SJIS','UTF-8'); $password = str_replace( array( '&', '"', "'", '<', '>' ), array( '&', '"', ''', '<', '>' ), $password ); $salt = substr($password.'H.',1,2); $salt = preg_replace('/[^.\/0-9:;<=>?@A-Z\[\\\]\^_`a-z]/','.',$salt); $salt = strtr($salt,':;<=>?@[\]^_`','ABCDEFGabcdef'); return substr(crypt($password,$salt),-10); }

Credits to kusaba if I recall correctly. I modified it slightly.

Read full topic

item.title: Tripcode Generator
item.dc:creator: @cumescape cumescape
item.description:
@cumescape wrote:

I made a PHP tripcode generator to support Japanese characters/updated to support the pound symbol and a name before the trip. It outputs a 4channel and a 2channel format tripcode (only difference being the separator).

I would show a preview but my site has been blocked because I had a forum on it, although I never used it.

<?php
function hashtrip($name){
	$name = stripslashes($name);
	$haspound = strpos($name, "#");
	if($haspound === FALSE){ //the pound is not in the $name so continue w/o it
		$nameo;
		$trip = $name;
	}
	else{ //pound is in $name so explode to seperate it from the trip and name
		$t = explode('#', $name);
		$nameo = $t[0];
		$trip = $t[1];
	}
	if((function_exists('mb_convert_encoding'))){
		mb_substitute_character('none');
		$recoded_cap = mb_convert_encoding($trip, 'Shift_JIS', 'UTF-8');
	}
	$trip = (($recoded_cap != '') ? $recoded_cap : $trip);
	$salt = substr($trip.'H.', 1, 2);
	$salt = preg_replace('/[^\.-z]/', '.', $salt);
	$salt = strtr($salt, ':;<=>?@[\]^_`', 'ABCDEFGabcdef');
	$output = substr(crypt($trip, $salt), -10);
	echo '<table border="0" align="center" style="text-align: left; color:#DAD6D5;">
	<tr class="odd">
		<th scope="row">Input</th>
		<td>'.$name.'</td>
	</tr>
	<tr class="even">
		<th scope="row">Read</th>
		<td>'.$trip.'</td>
	</tr>
	<tr class="odd">
		<th scope="row">Output (4ch)</th>
		<td>'.$nameo.'!'.$output.'</td>
	</tr>
	<tr class="even">
		<th scope="row">Output (2ch)</th>
		<td>'.$nameo.'◆'.$output.'</td>
	</tr>
</table>';
}
?>
